summary: Ecosystems transcend natural boundaries, representing both biological entities confined by space and time, and modern, decentralized, resilient organizational structures. The articles within emphasize decentralized, regenerative designs to solve global challenges, fostering renewal and resilience.
excerpt: Biological ecosystems are specific to space and time, but the term ecosystem has been broadened to describe non-natural organizations, underscoring a shift towards organic, decentralized structures. Innovation should enhance the planet and society. Decentralized, regenerative design can solve global challenges, shifting from harmful practices to resilient, interconnected ecosystems.
